pr_title: Don't retry on network failure on writes

timeline.message: Don't retry on network failure on writes

timeline.bodyText: HttpConstants.StatusCodes.FORBIDDEN, HttpConstants.SubStatusCodes.FORBIDDEN_WRITEFORBIDDEN will qualify as isWebExceptionRetriable ? If not then how does that case handled ?
timeline.author: simplynaveen20

replies.bodyText:
I don't think it will be qualified as WebExceptionRetriable
And in that case, we force refresh but I don't think we will retry.
Worth discussing over a meeting.
replies.author: kushagraThapar

timeline.bodyText: Isn't heading of PR is contradicting , we are retrying on write in case of network failure ? Until I am missing something
timeline.author: simplynaveen20

replies.bodyText:
We are only retrying if it is a readRequest, or WebExceptionRetriable.
In the else case, we are not retrying.. we are calling noRetry()
WebExceptionRetriable only returns true, when you are trying to connect but you get connection exception.
That means, we are sure we haven't reached the server.
replies.author: kushagraThapar

replies.bodyText: Ok so it is retry on write in case of connection exception , thinking other way round was confusing.
replies.author: simplynaveen20

timeline.message: Fixing the logic to retry on forbidden status code
